keywords.value: White House Council of Economic Advisers
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Even as President Obama sought support for the Trans-Pacific Partnership by acknowledging the downside of free-trade pacts, a report from his economic team cited their benefits.

headline.print_headline: Walking a Fine Line in Promoting a Trade Deal
headline.main: Walking a Fine Line in Promoting a Trade Deal

snippet: Even as President Obama sought support for the Trans-Pacific Partnership by acknowledging the downside of free-trade pacts, a report from his economic team cited their benefits.
abstract: White House Memo; report on economic benefits of trade pacts, issued by White House Council of Economic Advisers, declares that previous trade agreements did not result in outsourcing of American jobs; assertion contradicts Pres Obama's argument for Trans-Pacific Partnership trade pact that it would undo hardship placed on American workers by former trade agreements.
